<li id="cite_note-13"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-13">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://motortorque.askaprice.com/news/auto-0907/lotus-ceo-mike-kimberley-to-step-down.asp">"Lotus CEO Mike Kimberley to step down"</a>. Motortorque.askaprice.com<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 September</span> 2010</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALotus+Cars&amp;rft.btitle=Lotus+CEO+Mike+Kimberley+to+step+down&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fmotortorque.askaprice.com%2Fnews%2Fauto-0907%2Flotus-ceo-mike-kimberley-to-step-down.asp&amp;rft.pub=Motortorque.askaprice.com&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-14"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-14">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-norfolk-18215542">"Lotus owners suspend chief Bahar over complaint"</a>. <a href="/wiki/BBC_News" title="BBC News">BBC News</a>. 25 May 2012<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">25 May</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALotus+Cars&amp;rft.btitle=Lotus+owners+suspend+chief+Bahar+over+complaint&amp;rft.date=2012-05-25&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.co.uk%2Fnews%2Fuk-england-norfolk-18215542&amp;rft.pub=BBC+News&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-15"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-15">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation pressrelease"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.lotuscars.com/us/news/corporate/media-statement">"Lotus Appoints Chief Operating Officer – Confirms dismissal of Dany Bahar"</a> (Press release). Group Lotus plc. 7 June 2012<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">7 June</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALotus+Cars&amp;rft.btitle=Lotus+Appoints+Chief+Operating+Officer+%93+Confirms+dismissal+of+Dany+Bahar&amp;rft.date=2012-06-07&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lotuscars.com%2Fus%2Fnews%2Fcorporate%2Fmedia-statement&amp;rft.pub=Group+Lotus+plc&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-16"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-16">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Constructors' championship only; Drivers' title went to <a href="/wiki/Jackie_Stewart" title="Jackie Stewart">Jackie Stewart</a> of <a href="/wiki/Tyrrell_Racing" title="Tyrrell Racing">Tyrrell</a></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-17"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-17">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.grandprix.com/ns/ns00008.html">"Pacific forms alliance with Lotus"</a>. <i>grandprix.com</i>. 28 February 1995<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 December</span> 2016</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALotus+Cars&amp;rft.atitle=Pacific+forms+alliance+with+Lotus&amp;rft.date=1995-02-28&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.grandprix.com%2Fns%2Fns00008.html&amp;rft.jtitle=grandprix.com&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-18"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-18">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.topgear.com/uk/car-news/new-lotus-evora-400-revealed-2015-02-18">"Evora 400 is the fastest Lotus ever"</a>. <i>Top Gear</i>. 18 February 2015<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">18 February</span> 2015</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALotus+Cars&amp;rft.atitle=Evora+400+is+the+fastest+Lotus+ever&amp;rft.date=2015-02-18&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.topgear.com%2Fuk%2Fcar-news%2Fnew-lotus-evora-400-revealed-2015-02-18&amp;rft.jtitle=Top+Gear&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-19"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-19">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The rights to the Seven were sold in 1973 to <a href="/wiki/Caterham_Cars" title="Caterham Cars">Caterham Cars</a>. Updated versions of this 1957 design are also produced by other speciality firms, including <a href="/wiki/Westfield_Sportscars" title="Westfield Sportscars">Westfield Sportscars</a> and <a href="/wiki/Donkervoort" title="Donkervoort">Donkervoort</a>. Originally the number seven was applied to a <a href="/wiki/Riley_(car)" class="mw-redirect" title="Riley (car)">Riley</a>-powered Formula 2 car, but the vehicle was never completed in its original form, finally emerging instead as the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://forix.autosport.com/8w/clairmonte.html">Clairmonte Special</a>, a two-seat sports car powered by a Lea-Francis engine.</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-20"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-20">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation magazine"><a href="/w/index.php?title=Clive_Chapman&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Clive Chapman (page does not exist)">Chapman, Clive</a> (September 2016). "The Lotus That Never Blossomed". <i><a href="/wiki/Motor_Sport_(magazine)" title="Motor Sport (magazine)">Motor Sport</a></i>. Vol.&#160;92 no.&#160;9. pp.&#160;84–85.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALotus+Cars&amp;rft.au=Chapman%2C+Clive&amp;rft.btitle=The+Lotus+That+Never+Blossomed&amp;rft.date=2016-09&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.pages=84-85&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-21"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-21">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">A mid-engined sports car, launched in the early 1970s. It was styled by Italian designer <a href="/wiki/Giorgetto_Giugiaro" title="Giorgetto Giugiaro">Giorgetto Giugiaro</a>. The Esprit started with a light, 4-cylinder design, which went through several iterations of turbo-charging and electronic upgrades, before finally being replaced by a highly advanced V8. The last Lotus Esprit rolled off the production line on 20 February 2004, after 28 years in production. A total of 10,675 Esprits were built since production began in 1976.</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-22">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Grand_Tourer" class="mw-redirect" title="Grand Tourer">GT</a> inspired two-seater claimed to offer a more upmarket sportscar experience, although it is based on the same chassis as the Elise and Exige, limiting accommodation and practicality. Power comes from a Lotus-tuned variant of the turbocharged four-cylinder engine which powers the VX220. The Europa has been criticised in the motoring press for being expensive and for lacking equipment and practicality compared to rivals like the <a href="/wiki/Porsche_Cayman" class="mw-redirect" title="Porsche Cayman">Porsche Cayman</a>.</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-23">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.autoguide.com/auto-news/2010/08/lotus-125-ultimate-track-car-to-debut-at-pebble-beach-alongside-elise-sc-rg-edition.html">"Lotus 125 'Ultimate Track Car' to Debut at Pebble Beach Alongside Elise SC RGB Edition | AutoGuide.com News"</a>. <li id="cite_note-31"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-31">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.roadandtrack.com/new-cars/future-cars/news/a32341/lotus-suv-2021/">"Lotus Boss: Nobody Makes a "Lightweight, Good-Handling SUV<span style="padding-right:0.2em;">"</span>"</a>. <i>Road &amp; Track</i>. 2017-01-19<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-32"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-32">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web">Abuelsamid, Sam (22 June 2010). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://green.autoblog.com/2010/06/22/lotus-and-fagor-ederlan-group-to-produce-range-extender-engine/">"Lotus and Fagor Ederlan Group to produce range-extender engine – Autoblog Green"</a>. <li id="cite_note-34"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-34">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.thelotusforums.com/6374/latest-news/lotus-cars-news/lotus-fire-up-all-new-in-house-v8/">"[VIDEO] Lotus fire up all new in-house V8"</a>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">18 December</span> 2011</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALotus+Cars&amp;rft.btitle=%5BVIDEO%26%2393%3B+Lotus+fire+up+all+new+in-house+V8&amp;rft.date=2011-09-16&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thelotusforums.com%2F6374%2Flatest-news%2Flotus-cars-news%2Flotus-fire-up-all-new-in-house-v8%2F&amp;rft.pub=The+Lotus+Forums&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-35"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-35">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.lotuscars.com/engineering/en/centres">Lotus Engineering Centres</a>, retrieved 18 June 2010.</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-36"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-36">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.autoblog.com/2006/07/29/done-deal-lotus-will-build-the-tesla-roadster-in-hethel/">"Done deal! Lotus will build the Tesla Roadster in Hethel"</a>. autoblog. 29 July 2006<span class="reference-accessdate">. <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Further_reading">Further reading</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lotus_Cars&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: Further reading">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul>
<li>Gérard ('Jabby') Crombac, <i>Colin Chapman: The Man and His Cars</i> (Patrick Stephens, Wellingborough, 1986)</li>
<li>Mike Lawrence, <i>Colin Chapman: The Wayward Genius</i> (Breedon Books, Derby, 2002)</li>
<li>Ian H. Smith, <i>The Story of Lotus: 1947–1960 Birth of a Legend</i> (republished Motor Racing Publications, Chiswick, 1972)</li>
<li>Doug Nye, <i>The Story of Lotus: 1961–1971 Growth of a Legend</i> (Motor Racing Publications, Chiswick, 1972)</li>
<li>Robin Read, <i>Colin Chapman's Lotus: The early years, the Elite and the origins of the Elan</i> (Haynes, Sparkford, 1989)</li>
<li>Anthony Pritchard, <i>Lotus: All The Cars</i> (Aston Publications, Bourne End, 1990)</li>
<li>Doug Nye, <i>Theme Lotus: 1956–1986</i> (Motor Racing Publications, Croydon, 1986)</li>
<li>William Taylor <i>The Lotus Book</i> (Coterie Press, Luton, 1998, 1999, 2005)</li>
<li>William Taylor <i>The Lotus Book Collectibles</i> (Coterie Press, Luton, 2000)</li>
<li>Peter Ross, <i>Lotus – The Early Years 1951–54</i> (Coterie Press, Luton, 2004)</li>
<li>Rémy Solnon, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://lotusespritaddiction.unblog.fr/lotus-esprit-le-grand-tourisme-a-langlaise/"><i>Lotus Esprit – le grand tourisme à l'anglaise</i></a> (Editions Les Presses Littéraires, 2007)</li>
<li>Andrew Ferguson, <i>Team Lotus: The Indianapolis Years</i> (Haynes Publishing 1996) no longer available</li>
</ul>

<dt>Other notable drivers</dt>

<dd><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom"><img alt="United Kingdom" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Martin_Donnelly_(racing_driver)" title="Martin Donnelly (racing driver)">Martin Donnelly</a></dd>
<dd><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Finland" title="Finland"><img alt="Finland" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Flag_of_Finland.svg/23px-Flag_of_Finland.svg.png" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Flag_of_Finland.svg/35px-Flag_of_Finland.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Flag_of_Finland.svg/46px-Flag_of_Finland.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1800" data-file-height="1100" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Mika_H%C3%A4kkinen" title="Mika Häkkinen">Mika Häkkinen</a></dd>
<dd><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom"><img alt="United Kingdom" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Herbert" title="Johnny Herbert">Johnny Herbert</a></dd>

<div id="23x15px.7Cborder_.7Calt.3DUnited_Kingdom.7Clink.3DUnited_Kingdom_Lotus_F1_Team" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom"><img alt="United Kingdom" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Lotus_F1" title="Lotus F1"><span style="color:gold">Lotus F1 Team</span></a></div>

<tr>
<td colspan="2" class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0px">
<div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
<dl>
<dt>Notable personnel</dt>

<dd>Alan Permane</dd>
<dd><a href="/wiki/Andy_Ruhan" title="Andy Ruhan">Andy Ruhan</a></dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dt>Drivers</dt>
<dd><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Belgium" title="Belgium"><img alt="Belgium" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg/35px-Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg/45px-Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/J%C3%A9r%C3%B4me_d%27Ambrosio" title="Jérôme d'Ambrosio">Jérôme d'Ambrosio</a></dd>
<dd><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/France" title="France"><img alt="France" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/23px-Flag_of_France.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/35px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/45px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Romain_Grosjean" title="Romain Grosjean">Romain Grosjean</a></dd>
<dd><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Finland" title="Finland"><img alt="Finland" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Flag_of_Finland.svg/23px-Flag_of_Finland.svg.png" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Flag_of_Finland.svg/35px-Flag_of_Finland.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Flag_of_Finland.svg/46px-Flag_of_Finland.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1800" data-file-height="1100" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Heikki_Kovalainen" title="Heikki Kovalainen">Heikki Kovalainen</a></dd>
<dd><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Venezuela" title="Venezuela"><img alt="Venezuela" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/Flag_of_Venezuela.svg/23px-Flag_of_Venezuela.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/Flag_of_Venezuela.svg/35px-Flag_of_Venezuela.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/Flag_of_Venezuela.svg/45px-Flag_of_Venezuela.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Pastor_Maldonado" title="Pastor Maldonado">Pastor Maldonado</a></dd>
<dd><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Finland" title="Finland"><img alt="Finland" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Flag_of_Finland.svg/23px-Flag_of_Finland.svg.png" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Flag_of_Finland.svg/35px-Flag_of_Finland.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Flag_of_Finland.svg/46px-Flag_of_Finland.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1800" data-file-height="1100" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Kimi_R%C3%A4ikk%C3%B6nen" title="Kimi Räikkönen">Kimi Räikkönen</a></dd>
</dl>
<dl>
<dt><a href="/wiki/Formula_One" title="Formula One">Formula One</a> Cars</dt>

</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<th scope="row" class="navbox-group">Related topics</th>
<td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
<div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
<ul>
<li><img alt="Category" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/48/Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg/16px-Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg.png" title="Category" width="16" height="14" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/48/Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg/24px-Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/48/Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg/32px-Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="36" data-file-height="31" /> <a href="/wiki/Category:British_automobile_designers" title="Category:British automobile designers">Automobile designers</a></li>
<li><img alt="Category" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/48/Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg/16px-Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg.png" title="Category" width="16" height="14" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/48/Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg/24px-Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/48/Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg/32px-Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="36" data-file-height="31" /> <a href="/wiki/Category:British_automobile_magazines" title="Category:British automobile magazines">Automobile magazines</a>
<ul>
<li><small><i><a href="/wiki/Bauer_Media_Group#Other_publications" title="Bauer Media Group">AM Magazine</a></i></small></li>

</ul>
</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Institute_of_Advanced_Motorists" title="Institute of Advanced Motorists">Institute of Advanced Motorists (IAM)</a></li>

<tr>
<th scope="row" class="navbox-group">Components</th>
<td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
<div style="padding:0em 0.25em">

</tr>
